intro: Hieracium villosiceps subsp. villosifolium, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
